title: Create the Gapminder dataset
text:
# Import necessary libraries
import pandas as pd
from gapminder import gapminder

# Rename 'lifeExp' to 'life_expectancy' and 'gdpPercap' to 'gdp_per_capita'
gapminder = gapminder.rename(columns={'lifeExp': 'life_expectancy',
                                      'pop': 'population_millions', 
                                      'gdpPercap': 'gdp_per_capita'})

# Convert population to millions
gapminder['population_millions'] = gapminder['population_millions'] / 1_000_000

# Create a new pandas DataFrame from the modified gapminder data
gapminder_df = pd.DataFrame(gapminder)

# Save the DataFrame as a CSV file
gapminder_df.to_csv('gapminder.csv', index=False)

# Print the first 3 rows of the DataFrame
print(gapminder_df.head(3))

       country continent  year  life_expectancy  population_millions  \
0  Afghanistan      Asia  1952           28.801             8.425333   
1  Afghanistan      Asia  1957           30.332             9.240934   
2  Afghanistan      Asia  1962           31.997            10.267083   

   gdp_per_capita  
0      779.445314  
1      820.853030  
2      853.100710

title: Gapminder Analysis Website
text: This website analyzes the Gapminder dataset, which contains country-level data on life expectancy, GDP per capita, and population from 1952 to 2007.

title: Gapminder Analysis Website
text:
Pages

Life Expectancy and GDP per Capita
Life Expectancy and Population
Country Analysis

title: Country Analysis
text:
This page analyzes changes in life expectancy, GDP per capita, and population over time for a specific country.

import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

# Load dataset
df = pd.read_csv("gapminder.csv")

# Choose country (you can change this later)
country_name = "United States"

country_data = df[df["country"] == country_name]

# Life expectancy over time
plt.figure()
plt.plot(country_data["year"], country_data["life_expectancy"], marker="o")
plt.title(f"{country_name}: Life Expectancy Over Time")
plt.xlabel("Year")
plt.ylabel("Life Expectancy")
plt.show()

# GDP per capita over time
plt.figure()
plt.plot(country_data["year"], country_data["gdp_per_capita"], marker="o")
plt.title(f"{country_name}: GDP per Capita Over Time")
plt.xlabel("Year")
plt.ylabel("GDP per Capita")
plt.show()

# Population over time
plt.figure()
plt.plot(country_data["year"], country_data["population_millions"], marker="o")
plt.title(f"{country_name}: Population Over Time")
plt.xlabel("Year")
plt.ylabel("Population (millions)")
plt.show()

title: Interactive Life Expectancy Map
text:
This interactive map shows life expectancy by country.

import pandas as pd
import plotly.express as px

df = pd.read_csv("gapminder.csv")

# Use most recent year
latest = df[df["year"] == df["year"].max()]

fig = px.choropleth(
    latest,
    locations="country",
    locationmode="country names",
    color="life_expectancy",
    hover_name="country",
    color_continuous_scale="Viridis",
    title="Life Expectancy by Country"
)

fig.show()

title: Life Expectancy and GDP per Capita
text:
This page explores the relationship between life expectancy and GDP per capita across countries.

import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

# Load dataset
df = pd.read_csv("gapminder.csv")

# Create scatter plot
plt.figure()

for continent, subset in df.groupby("continent"):
    plt.scatter(
        subset["gdp_per_capita"],
        subset["life_expectancy"],
        alpha=0.5,
        label=continent,
        s=20
    )

plt.xscale("log")

plt.title("Life Expectancy vs GDP per Capita")
plt.xlabel("GDP per Capita (log scale)")
plt.ylabel("Life Expectancy")
plt.legend()
plt.show()

title: Life Expectancy and Population
text:
This page explores the relationship between life expectancy and population across countries.

import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

# Load dataset
df = pd.read_csv("gapminder.csv")

# Scatter plot: life expectancy vs population
plt.figure()
plt.scatter(df["population_millions"], df["life_expectancy"], alpha=0.5, s=20)

plt.title("Life Expectancy vs Population")
plt.xlabel("Population (millions)")
plt.ylabel("Life Expectancy")
plt.show()
